instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: Hello, we have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in for battery replacement. After the battery was replaced, we have a black display. We have tried a known working display and same situation. Display completely black, so its not no backlight. I checked, we have 5V (<CAPACITOR>C8512</CAPACITOR>)  for a second and then drops to 0v, and 0.144v on Backlight IC (<CAPACITOR>C8500</CAPACITOR>). Pin 23 from LCD connector 0v. Any idea what can cause this. I connect to external display and that works. Also noticed KBD not working (worked before). Could it be related to i.e. a damaged keyboard flex cable? Will try another cable tomorrow as first I am backing up the data from this pile of trash.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal.
Incorrect level will disbale internal image and TP/KB.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message: OK thanks will report back tomorrow.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.2v

Some more info. I checked with another board and this display and it works. When I connect the non working board I did find <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> = 0v on the working board it is present. The issue is not no backlight though, as I have no image at all. Also when I connect to external display, keyboard did not work, but Trackpad I can feel clicking.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display
threads.message:
Same TP/KB work with the other board?

Backlight is the last to appear; image must come first.
You may have no backlight issue at all; find why there is no image.

Check if both 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> appear at J8500 in the first seconds (when chime).
If yes, <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> should come high at same time.
